Add Cites to RMarkdown
========================================================

```{r setup, include = FALSE, cache = FALSE}
library(RefManageR)
#library(bibtex)
setwd("C:/Users/Matthew/Documents/biblatex/RefManager/code/RefManageR/R")
# source("rmdCite.R")
#lapply(list.files(pattern = ".R$", full = TRUE), source)
bib <- ReadBib(system.file("Bib", "biblatexExamples.bib", 
                           package = "RefManageR"), check = FALSE)
bib2 <- ReadBib(system.file("Bib", "RJC.bib", package = "RefManageR"))
```
  This is an R Markdown document. This is an example of a citation in the text `r Citep(bib, "loh")`. Now we cite in parentheses `r AutoCite(bib, 1)`.

These are reports `r Citet(bib, 1, cite.style = "super")`.
You can also embed plots, for example: 
  
```{r fig.width=7, fig.height=6}
plot(cars)
```
Add a reference to TeX without citing`r NoCite(bib, "title = CTAN")`.  Add a reference from another bibliography `r TextCite(bib2, "author = Wang")`
**References**
```{r results = "asis", echo = FALSE}
PrintBibliography(bib)
```
